param.name: First Name

param.hint: Please enter the ID associated with the new user's branch

param.hint: Please provide an initial password for the user

variable.name: TOPdesk administrator
variable.description: Please provide the username of a TOPdesk administrator account with API permissions.

variable.name: TOPdesk administrator password
variable.description: Please provide the password for the TOPdesk administrator account.

variable.name: TOPdesk URL
variable.description: Please provide the TOPdesk server address. Example: https://172.128.11.110 Example: https://topdesk.mycorpserv.com https://partnerships.topdesk.net https://ressoftware.topdesk.net

settings.source:
#basic script to query TOPdesk instance for custoemr specific incident values. #Use when building RES ONE Service Store services to quickly have values on hand.
add-type @" using System.Net; using System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates; public class TrustAllCertsPolicy : ICertificatePolicy { public bool CheckValidationResult( ServicePoint srvPoint, X509Certificate certificate, WebRequest request, int certificateProblem) { return true; } } "@ [System.Net.ServicePointManager]::CertificatePolicy = New-Object TrustAllCertsPolicy
#User parameters $surName = "$[LastName]" $firstName = "$[First Name]" $employeeNumber = "$[EmployeeNumber]" $tempName = "$[Network Login Name]" $networkLoginName = $tempName.ToLower() $branch = "$[Branch ID]" $tasLoginName = "$[TOPdesk Portal login name]" $password = "$[password]" $email = '$[Users Email]' $jobtitle = '$[Job Title]' $DepartmentID = "$[DepartmentID]"
#instance paramters $admin = "$[Topdesk Admin]" $Adminpwd = "$[TOPdesk Admin Password]" $TOPdeskUrl = "$[TOPdesk URL]" $token $baseUri = $TOPdeskUrl+"/tas/api"
$token = Invoke-RestMethod -Method Get -Uri ($baseUri+"/login/operator") -Headers @{"Authorization" = "Basic "+[System.Convert]::ToBase64String([System.Text.Encoding]::UTF8.GetBytes($admin+":"+$Adminpwd ))}
$headers = New-Object "System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary[[String],[String]]" $headers.Add("Authorization", "TOKEN id=`"$token`"")
$output = "" $results = ""
$body = @"
{ "surName" : "$surName", "firstName" : "$firstName", "prefixes" : "", "employeeNumber" : "$employeeNumber", "networkLoginName" : "$networkLoginName", "email" : "$email", "branch" : { "id": "$branch" }, "department" : { "id": "$DepartmentID" }, "tasLoginName" : "$tasLoginName", "password" : "$password", "showBudgetholder" : true, "showDepartment" : true, "showBranch" : false, "showSubsidiaries" : false, "manager" : null, "isManager" : false, "jobTitle" : "$jobtitle", "authorizeAll" : false, "authorizeDepartment" : true, "authorizeBudgetHolder" : false, "authorizeBranch" : false, "authorizeSubsidiaryBranches" : false } "@
$results = Invoke-RestMethod -Method Post -Uri ($baseUri+"/persons") -Headers $headers -Body $body -ContentType 'application/json'
$results.id

variable.name: TOPdesk administrator
variable.description: Please provide the username of a TOPdesk administrator account with API permissions.

variable.name: TOPdesk administrator password
variable.description: Please provide the password for the TOPdesk administrator account.

variable.description: Please provide the TOPdesk server address. Example: https://172.128.11.110 Example: https://topdesk.mycorpserv.com https://partnerships.topdesk.net https://ressoftware.topdesk.net

settings.source:
#basic script to query TOPdesk instance for custoemr specific incident values. #Use when building RES ONE Service Store services to quickly have values on hand.
add-type @" using System.Net; using System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates; public class TrustAllCertsPolicy : ICertificatePolicy { public bool CheckValidationResult( ServicePoint srvPoint, X509Certificate certificate, WebRequest request, int certificateProblem) { return true; } } "@ [System.Net.ServicePointManager]::CertificatePolicy = New-Object TrustAllCertsPolicy
#User parameters $surName = "$[LastName]" $firstName = "$[First Name]" $employeeNumber = "$[EmployeeNumber]" $tempName = "$[Network Login Name]" $networkLoginName = $tempName.ToLower() $branch = "$[Branch ID]" $tasLoginName = "$[TOPdesk Portal login name]" $password = "$[password]" $email = '$[Users Email]' $jobtitle = '$[Job Title]' $DepartmentID = "$[DepartmentID]" ## Test Block to trim newline $tasLoginName = $tasLoginName -replace "`t|`n|`r","" $branch = $branch -replace "`t|`n|`r","" $DepartmentID = $DepartmentID -replace "`t|`n|`r","" ## #instance paramters $admin = "$[Topdesk Admin]" $Adminpwd = "$[TOPdesk Admin Password]" $TOPdeskUrl = "$[TOPdesk URL]" $token $baseUri = $TOPdeskUrl+"/tas/api"
$token = Invoke-RestMethod -Method Get -Uri ($baseUri+"/login/operator") -Headers @{"Authorization" = "Basic "+[System.Convert]::ToBase64String([System.Text.Encoding]::UTF8.GetBytes($admin+":"+$Adminpwd ))}
$headers = New-Object "System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary[[String],[String]]" $headers.Add("Authorization", "TOKEN id=`"$token`"")
$output = "" $results = ""
$body = @"
{ "surName" : "$surName", "firstName" : "$firstName", "prefixes" : "", "employeeNumber" : "$employeeNumber", "networkLoginName" : "$networkLoginName", "email" : "$email", "branch" : { "id": "$branch" }, "department" : { "id": "$DepartmentID" }, "tasLoginName" : "$tasLoginName", "password" : "$password", "showBudgetholder" : true, "showDepartment" : true, "showBranch" : false, "showSubsidiaries" : false, "manager" : null, "isManager" : false, "jobTitle" : "$jobtitle", "authorizeAll" : false, "authorizeDepartment" : true, "authorizeBudgetHolder" : false, "authorizeBranch" : false, "authorizeSubsidiaryBranches" : false } "@
$results = Invoke-RestMethod -Method Post -Uri ($baseUri+"/persons") -Headers $headers -Body $body -ContentType 'application/json'
$results.id
